cleanslate.page.flat_impeti.title: Flat Impeti
cleanslate.page.flat_impeti.0: I find it odd how my $(l:greatwork/impetus)$(thing)Impeti$() jut out of my neat, flush circuit of $(l:items/slate)$(item)slates$(). This egregious anomaly $(o)can not$() be tolerated. By dropping an $(item)Anvil$() on top of an $(l:greatwork/impetus)$(thing)Impetus$(), I can flatten it to the thickness of a regular $(l:items/slate)$(item)Slate$(). It $(o)probably$() doesn't hurt the villager inside.
cleanslate.page.withered_slates.title: Withered Slates
cleanslate.page.withered_slates.0: $(l:greatwork/spellcircles)$(thing)Spell circles$() are unable to extend upwards past their $(item)$(l:items/slate)slates$() and while I can use $(l:greatwork/directrix)$(item)Directrices$() in order to redirect the wave upwards, that is often an eyesore. Rumors have it that some horrible monster can produce a $(o)flower$() that can help extend the ambit of my $(l:greatwork/spellcircles)$(thing)circle$() upwards and downwards to essentially infinity after the wave passes over it.
cleanslate.page.withered_slates.1: $(o)Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.$()
